alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 3:29PM MST until September 10 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... northern Gila County in east central Arizona... southeastern Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 630 PM MST /730 PM MDT/. * At 327 PM MST /427 PM MDT/, National Weather Service Flagstaff Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over Chevelon Creek, west of Forest Lakes. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sinkhole Campground and Forest Road 171 Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 282 and 285. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Chevelon Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
